page.title: 06Gourdon Harbour
page.content: {Gourdon harbour}is well situated nestling at the foot of cliffs. The harbour is a very busy part of the village both as a tourist attraction and as a place of work. You can climb Gourdon Hill and get a good view of the village and the harbour. Although the harbour is not very big there are quite a lot of boats to be seen. There is also a little harbour where the little boats moor. In the big harbour you can see boats landing their catch. Usually once a year there is a gala at the harbour where people can come and go out on a trip in the boats. In the summer a lot of pleasure craft come into the harbour.
